meanings.definition: A person who demands or requires precise conformity or compliance.
meanings.sent1: The exacters in the group always want everything to be just right.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was known as an exacters because she expected all assignments to be done perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The exacters at the office made sure all the files were organized alphabetically.
meanings.sent4: She was an exacters when it came to following the recipe for the cake.
meanings.sent5: The exacters in the team ensured that every detail was checked multiple times.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for measuring or cutting with precision.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used an exacters to measure the length of the wood accurately.
meanings.sent2: The tailor's favorite exacters was a sharp pair of scissors.
meanings.sent3: The chef's exacters, a digital scale, helped in measuring ingredients precisely.
meanings.sent4: The artist's exacters, a fine brush, allowed for intricate details in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's exacters, a microscope, revealed the tiny organisms in the water sample.
